Class Automaton

  • java.lang.Object
    • Automaton
  • public class Automaton
extends java.lang.Object
    This class generates Elementary Cellular Automata and evolves them any number of times based on 256 possible rules.
    Author:
    Devin McAfee

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<Generation> Automaton
      The ECA, which is an ArrayList composed of Generation objects.
      private char falseSymbol
      The symbol used to represent false in the ECA.
      private int numSteps
      The number of evolutions, or generations, of the ECA.
      private int ruleNum
      The rule number represented in base 10.
      private char trueSymbol
      The symbol used to represent true in the ECA.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Automaton​(int ruleNum, boolean[] initState)
      Constructor initializing ruleNum to the ruleNum parameter and creating a Generation object using the initState parameter and adding said object to the Automaton ArrayList.
      Automaton​(java.lang.String filename)
      Constructor that takes a given file and, using the nextLine() method of the Scanner class, assigns the first line of the file to ruleNum, the first and second words of the second line of the file to falseSymbol and trueSymbol respectively using the next() method of Scanner, and creates an initial Automaton with a single generation using a for-loop that iterates through the third line and searches for false and true symbols.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void evolve​(int numSteps)
      Evolves the Automaton according to the ruleNum field a given number of times using a for-loop and the evolve() method of the Generation class.
      char getFalseSymbol()
      Gets the symbol representing false.
      int getRuleNum()
      Gets the ruleNum field.
      boolean[] getState​(int stepNum)
      Gets the state of the Automaton at a generation after a given number of steps, i.e, evolutions.
      java.lang.String getStateString​(int stepNum)
      Gets the state of the Automaton after a given number of steps-- using a for-loop that iterates through the generation and looks for 0's, corresponding to false, and 1's, corresponding to true-- in the form of a String composed of the false and true symbol fields.
      int getTotalSteps()
      Gets the value stored in the numSteps field.
      char getTrueSymbol()
      Gets the symbol representing true.
      void save​(java.lang.String filename)
      Saves the Automaton in toString() format to a given file using the print() method of the PrintWriter class.
      void setFalseSymbol​(char symbol)
      Sets the false symbol field to a given char.
      void setTrueSymbol​(char symbol)
      Sets the true symbol field to a given char.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string of the format created in the getStateString() method, in which each state string, except for the final string, is separated by a newline character.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • numSteps

        private int numSteps
        The number of evolutions, or generations, of the ECA.

      • ruleNum

        private int ruleNum
        The rule number represented in base 10.

      • Automaton

        private java.util.ArrayList<Generation> Automaton
        The ECA, which is an ArrayList composed of Generation objects.

      • falseSymbol

        private char falseSymbol
        The symbol used to represent false in the ECA.

      • trueSymbol

        private char trueSymbol
        The symbol used to represent true in the ECA.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Automaton

        public Automaton​(int ruleNum,
                 boolean[] initState)
        Constructor initializing ruleNum to the ruleNum parameter and creating a Generation object using the initState parameter and adding said object to the Automaton ArrayList. Sets the falseSymbol field to a default value of '0', the trueSymbol field to a default value of '1', and numSteps to 0.
        Parameters:
        ruleNum - the base 10 form of the rule by which the Automaton will evolve.
        initState - the initial state, or the first generation, of the Automaton.

      • Automaton

        public Automaton​(java.lang.String filename)
          throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Constructor that takes a given file and, using the nextLine() method of the Scanner class, assigns the first line of the file to ruleNum, the first and second words of the second line of the file to falseSymbol and trueSymbol respectively using the next() method of Scanner, and creates an initial Automaton with a single generation using a for-loop that iterates through the third line and searches for false and true symbols.
        Parameters:
        filename - a given filename associated with a created file with information on the fields.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

    • Method Detail

      • getRuleNum

        public int getRuleNum()
        Gets the ruleNum field.
        Returns:
        returns an int value representing the base 10 equivalent of the rule governing the Automaton

      • evolve

        public void evolve​(int numSteps)
        Evolves the Automaton according to the ruleNum field a given number of times using a for-loop and the evolve() method of the Generation class.
        Parameters:
        numSteps - and int value representing the number of times the Automaton is evolved; hence the number of generations the evolved Automaton will have.

      • getTotalSteps

        public int getTotalSteps()
        Gets the value stored in the numSteps field.
        Returns:
        an int value representing the number of generations associated with the Automaton.

      • getState

        public boolean[] getState​(int stepNum)
        Gets the state of the Automaton at a generation after a given number of steps, i.e, evolutions. Uses a for-loop to iterate through each cell of the desired generation, and uses the getState() method of the Cell class to get the state of each cell, either 0 or 1, and assigns true or false respectively to each position of the returned boolean array.
        Parameters:
        stepNum - an int value representing the number of steps associated with a specific generation of the Automaton.
        Returns:
        a boolean array representing the generation of the Automaton after a given number of steps.

      • getStateString

        public java.lang.String getStateString​(int stepNum)
        Gets the state of the Automaton after a given number of steps-- using a for-loop that iterates through the generation and looks for 0's, corresponding to false, and 1's, corresponding to true-- in the form of a String composed of the false and true symbol fields.
        Parameters:
        stepNum - an int value representing a specific generation of the Automaton.
        Returns:
        a String composed of false and true symbols representing the desired generation of the Automaton.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string of the format created in the getStateString() method, in which each state string, except for the final string, is separated by a newline character. Iterates through each generation of the Automaton using a for-loop.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string composed of the states of the Automaton.

      • save

        public void save​(java.lang.String filename)
          throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Saves the Automaton in toString() format to a given file using the print() method of the PrintWriter class.
        Parameters:
        filename - a String representing the name of the file to which the Automaton is saved.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the given file cannot be found.

      • getFalseSymbol

        public char getFalseSymbol()
        Gets the symbol representing false.
        Returns:
        the false symbol field.

      • setFalseSymbol

        public void setFalseSymbol​(char symbol)
        Sets the false symbol field to a given char.
        Parameters:
        symbol - a char representing the new false symbol.

      • getTrueSymbol

        public char getTrueSymbol()
        Gets the symbol representing true.
        Returns:
        the true symbol field.

      • setTrueSymbol

        public void setTrueSymbol​(char symbol)
        Sets the true symbol field to a given char.
        Parameters:
        symbol - a char representing the new true symbol.
